abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books New York and the First World War: Shaping an American City by Ross J Wilson and Life in New York: How I Learned to Love Squeegee Men, Token Suckers, Trash Twisters and Subway Sharks by Laura Pedersen.
lead_paragraph: Ross J. Wilson argues that World War I transformed New York from an immigrant hub to an American metropolis, and Laura Pedersen, a transplant from upstate, assesses Manhattan in fond essays.

headline.main: New Books on the City After War and After Buffalo
headline.print_headline: The War That United New York

snippet: Ross J. Wilson argues that World War I transformed New York from an immigrant hub to an American metropolis, and Laura Pedersen, a transplant from upstate, assesses Manhattan in fond essays.
